getChildElementNames

public java.util.Vector getChildElementNames(java.lang.String key)
Returns the immediate (one level) child element names of the provided key

Parameters:
key - the parent key of who's children will be searched.
The key should be passed as delimited (.) string representing the hierarchy of the element.

Example:
Consider the following XML extract

<organization>
  <division>
    <unit>
      <employee>
        <name></name>
        <empid></empid>
      </employee>
    </unit>
  </division>
</organization>



searching for the children of employee will require a key string like this to be used
organization.division.unit.employee

The output will be a vector with values name & empid
Returns:
a Vector with the child names

getValue

public static java.lang.String getValue(java.lang.String xmlFile,
                                        java.lang.String path)
                                 throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                        java.io.IOException,
                                        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
convert the path seperated by dots and return the value of the node

Parameters:

Returns:
the value of the resulting node
Throws:
